security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing release workflow instructions. No executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond documentation reading.

content.user_title: Automate npm package releases with version sync
content.value_statement: Manual npm releases often lead to version mismatches between package.json, git tags, and changelogs. This skill provides a bulletproof workflow that keeps all version markers in perfect sync.
actual_capabilities: Ensures version sync across package.json, CHANGELOG.md, and git tags
Provides step-by-step git operations for release commits
Includes dry-run testing before actual npm publish
Documents rollback procedures for failed releases
limitations: Only works for cc-devflow package (needs adaptation for others)
Requires main branch with clean working directory
Does not support pre-release or beta versions

use_cases.title: Release new features safely
use_cases.description: Publish minor version updates with proper changelog documentation and git tagging

use_cases.title: Fix and release patches
use_cases.description: Quickly release bug fixes while maintaining version consistency across all markers

use_cases.title: Standardize release process
use_cases.description: Establish consistent release workflow across team members

prompt_templates.title: Release patch version
prompt_templates.prompt: Walk me through releasing a patch version for cc-devflow. Current version is 2.4.3 and I've fixed a critical bug in the checklist validation.

prompt_templates.title: Release minor version
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to release version 2.5.0 with new TDD enforcement features. Guide me through the complete workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Check release readiness
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me verify that my repository is ready for release - check git status, current version, and recent commits.

prompt_templates.title: Rollback failed release
prompt_templates.prompt: I accidentally published a broken version 2.4.5. How do I unpublish it and rollback the git changes?

best_practices: Always run npm publish --dry-run first to catch packaging issues
Update CHANGELOG.md before committing version changes
Use annotated git tags with descriptive release messages
Verify package installation works after publishing
anti_patterns: Never push tags before committing version changes
Don't skip changelog updates for any release
Avoid manual version editing without using npm version command

faq.question: Is this compatible with other npm packages?
faq.answer: The workflow is generic but examples reference cc-devflow. Adapt the package name and repository URLs for your project.

faq.question: What if npm publish fails due to network issues?
faq.answer: The workflow includes network troubleshooting steps. Retry after connection stabilizes or switch to SSH for git operations.

faq.question: Can I use this for beta or pre-release versions?
faq.answer: The current workflow focuses on stable releases. Pre-release versions need additional npm tag configuration.

faq.question: How do I handle release failures after 72 hours?
faq.answer: After 72 hours, npm unpublish is unavailable. Publish a new patch version with the fix instead of unpublishing.

faq.question: Does this integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: This is a manual workflow. For CI/CD integration, you'll need additional automation scripts and npm tokens.

faq.question: What permissions do I need?
faq.answer: npm publish permission for the package, git push access to the repository, and optionally GitHub CLI for release creation.
